Great Western themed boardgame! The animations, controls, and theme all work very well with the gameplay. The solo story mode with comic book chapters is a nice touch. Lots of unlocks and achievements to give this game replayability. I play a lot of boardgame apps and this is one of my favorites. I haven't played online yet, but there is a good challenge with solo play. Very happy to add this to my boardgame app collection! One of my top favs now.

Getting a local multiplayer is too difficult; need to create an online game and hope some rando doesn't jump in instead of your friend. There are a few bugs too, like the character selection and how it doesn't let you pick a character. Fix those and I'll rate it 5/5.
This is a very entertaining card based programming game that eliminates all the fiddliness of the physical board game, and allows you to just have fun with the game play.
I want my money back. This game doesn't let me play with my friend. It has an error code each time I try to do anything. Very disappointed. Paying for a game should not have this sort of issue.

content: Buggy buggy buggy. Card from planning stage doesn't correspond card from robbery stage :(

One of the bugs of this game is that you may not be able to exicute an action, because the game places the icon that you need to push to perform the action behind one of the character pictures. The game freezes and you have to start over. The game uses a lot of power, if you forget to turn it of it will run your battery down.

Needs pass-and-play, and an option to turn off or greatly speed up the long animations. Very pretty, at least. I'm not especially sold on the story mode; having different goals than the rest of the players sounds fun in theory, but it winds up being not a lot of fun - each story mode level feels like a puzzle that's only got one solution. Anyway, enjoyable enough but without pass-and-play I'll probably not play it much.
A board game conversion with no pass and play? Why on Earth are missing such a basic feature? It doesn't even seem so hard to implement in a game where such as this

content: I bought this as an offline game, and have been playing the chapters (of which there are plenty). Lastly, the animations require the ability to be sped up.

content: Really fun. Just like the board game.

This is a really great game. It's the type of game that's just good old 
crazy fun. In addition to what I expected, I was pleasantly surprised at 
the level of detail put into creating backstories, unlockable comics, etc 
for each character. It really adds a lot to the game. The minus one star is 
for a startup bug. When I first started the game after downloading, I got 
an error message telling me the game didn't have access to my device's 
storage, and to go enable it in my device settings. It never asked me for 
that permission like games usually do, it just told me it didn't have it. I 
did manage to find and grant the needed access in my tablet's settings, but 
it was a bit of an odd bug (and I tried closing and re-opening the app 
several times first to see if it would ask for the needed permissions 
before going digging around in my settings). Still, this isn't exactly a 
game breaking issue, and I really am enjoying the game so far. A five star 
game, with one star removed for a relatively minor bug.

Fantastic port, I love the boardgame and do not bring it to the table 
enough so this is a good way to keep playing although AI often seem to play

The game plays very much like the board game with an added Story mode. 
However, the game requires you to be online at all times which wouldn't 
normally big a big deal except that it either CRASHES or DISCONNECTS much 
too often. Not only that, but the game doesn't save your progress so 
basically, you have to replay the entire level all over again. (some levels 
are also tough to beat and there's a random element at the start of reach 
level) This is really, really frustrating and basically makes the game 
unplayable. I'm truly disappointed want the worst part yet is I paid for it 
too. Of your interested in playing the game, I suggest you find some 
friends and just play the real boardgame.

After playing the tabletop version of Chile Express once, I wanted to try it out some more to see if I wanted to buy a physical copy. So I downloaded the app.  It turns out this is one of the most surprisingly detailed board game adaptations out there. The train, originally a cardboard model, has become a 3D train chugging at high speed across the Western landscape. The player pawns become colorful, partially animated drawings straight out of the instruction book's illustrations. They look like cutouts come to life, even though the original game uses wooden pawns.  And then there's the music! It captures the Spaghetti Western feel perfectly, with hummable tunes and a theme for each character. They practically scream “make my day.” Try listening with some good headphones sometime! There's a lot of musical detail that will go to waste if you don't.  As for the board game itself, this is an excellent tabletop title that I definitely want to own, and will be reserving a spot on my shelf for it. It takes programmable movement, secret actions, unique character powers, and a clever theme, turning them into something fun and unique.  Despite my high rating, there's still some room for improvement. Here's what needs attention:  1. This game is rated Everyone 10+, but the bonus comics — which are easily earned and accessed — contain some strictly adult subject material and even an early instance of the F word. Really, this deserves a teen rating, minimum, with the comics included.  2. The AI doesn't understand the rules variants very well... or in one case, at all. AI opponents never seem to brave the Flames, they don't know how to “give” the Cursed Amulet, and they are completely befuddled by the Flat-Bed Car, to the point where the Flat-Bed Car variant kills all semblance of a challenge when used in one-player games.  3. Online mode is so unintuitive that I've yet to manage to complete an online game at all. Players don't join and rarely invite, and the chat room is dead most of the time. Quick Play never seems to live up to its name. Something needs to be changed to entice players into actually participating.  4. What really irks me about the game is that even though it intentionally tries to include a wide variety of races — white, black, Hispanic, and Native American — the charter designer / comic artist obviously put no research at all into the Native American character “Cheyenne.” Heck, her name is the name of a TRIBE, not meant for an individual person. Her brothers in the comic are dumb and lazy, while Cheyenne lectures them on respecting the law (i.e., white European law).  Even her music sounds like a “mystic savage” racist stereotype.  Come on, guys. You've got a great game: bring it into the 21st century. All you need to do is abandon the pre-1960s stereotypes and look up some history online rather than making stuff up.

I have a problem with the rating being E10 when Django's comic pages have profanity. I'm not personally offended, but I'd hate to see that slip by someone who does care. Other than that, it's a great implementation of the board game. Would love to see expansion material!

content: The graphics are amazing. Animation is smooth. Great game! Best challenge is in story mode.
Great fun

As far as gameplay, graphics, and reproducing the tabletop game, this app gets 5 stars. -1 star for no pass and play and -1 star for not saving a local game in progress when you leave the app. Adding those 2 features, which I've kind of come to expect in digital board games, would make this app pretty close to perfect.
replyContent:
Hello Russel,
Concerning your local save, it is linked to a permission issue. Please follow this FAQ link to solve it: https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/colt-express/?s=general&f=android-6-0-i-have-an-issue-with-the-storage-authorization-management&l=en

content: Fantastic!  I'm already a huge fan of the board game, this app makes just as awesome in most ways, and even better in others.   Hoping to see the board game expansions as unlockable game options as I continue to play.
I cant switch apps or take a call while in an online game without being disconnected from the game. A little frustrating.
Love it, faithful to the cardboard original.  Devs are quick to address issues
replyContent: Good afternoon, we have released a new patch, can you please download it and retry? Please also check that the storage authorization is active for Colt Express (you can find this in the phone Settings-->Application Management)

content: Works great
Lovely adaption of the boardgame.

Please give some local play over bluetooth or wifi .. besides - great game ... just like the board game too ... :)
